TopicTitle: My First Mun Landing and Rover!

Articles.Content:
Hello all - just joined the forums and wanted to say hello ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Also I landed on the Mun on my first attempt ever ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (Spent a lot of time reading haha) and got my rover and kerbals to the Mun!

Hope to keep browsing these forums and see more of you guys, your awesome creations, and cool adventures!

![2WDEWiu.png](%5Bimg%5Dhttp%3A//i.imgur.com/2WDEWiu.png)![JUXr6j2.png](%5Bimg%5Dhttp%3A//i.imgur.com/JUXr6j2.png)

Welcome to the forums! I also lurked for a long time before posting for the first time haha. As you can see from my post count I still mainly just lurk lol. My first post was an epic kethane mining colony on Minmus, something I'm still pretty proud of today. Congrats on the Mun landing! I remember the first time I landed on the Mun. I failed miserably several times before finally figuring out how to kill my horizontal velocity, and probably only after watching some Scott Manley videos. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Would be interesting in seeing it landed before rover was detached.

You never forget your first time.

Why, I remember the first time I landed on Mun. We named the crater after the pilot - still, any landing you watch from a safe distance, hey?

Congratulations.

Welcome and job well done!

I started out lurking as well, but it's been this way for me for every forum I became a part of.

Original rover by the way! Especially like the stacked/staggered seating and wheel arrangement.
Welcome! Your rocket look like standart. But applause for your amazing rover! I like it!
You got that to the Mun on your first try? Very impressive! Well done!
Good job, mate! (I wish I could build Rovers as good as that one)
